elements.title: Silver
elements.contents: ... that on the day of her Silver concert, singer Regine Velasquez (pictured) suffered from a viral infection and temporarily lost her voice?

elements.title: LaDainian Tomlinson
elements.contents: ... that LaDainian Tomlinson scored two touchdowns in 47 seconds to break the NFL single-season touchdown record?

elements.title: Capri Sun
elements.contents: ... that tobacco conglomerate Philip Morris Cos. marketed Capri Sun to children based on experience selling tobacco to young people?

elements.title: African Civilization Society
elements.contents: ... that in the aftermath of the American Civil War, the only Black-led organization providing teachers to formerly enslaved people was the African Civilization Society?

elements.title: Gother Mann
elements.contents: ... that Gother Mann commanded a small body of militia on Dominica during the French invasion in 1778?

elements.title: Ward v. Flood
elements.contents: ... that Ward v. Flood was the legal basis for racially segregated education in California?

elements.title: Kenneth Willoughby Heaton
elements.contents: ... that Kenneth Willoughby Heaton developed the Bristol stool scale for classifying the consistency of human faeces?

elements.title: the smallest TV station in the United States
elements.contents: ... that the Los Angeles Times, the Chicago Tribune, and Sports Illustrated have all profiled the smallest TV station in the United States?
